medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. A, a 34-year-old man, admitted for a manic episode and alcohol withdrawal after a significantly increased alcohol consumption and cessation of medication in the past three months. Symptoms included difficulty sleeping, increased energy, pressured speech, and grandiosity. His last drink was 10 hours prior to admission. On admission, he was diaphoretic and tremulous with elevated blood pressure (180/110 mmHg) and pulse (115 bpm). The Clinical Institute Withdrawal Assessment score was 16.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 15-year history of schizoaffective disorder and 12-year history of alcoholism.
medical_history.social_history: Increased alcohol consumption in the three months before hospitalization; not specified regarding other lifestyle factors.
